pub.citation: Moller, M. et al. 2009. A preliminary phylogeny of the ‘didymocarpoid Gesneriaceae’ based on three molecular data sets: Incongruence with available tribal classifications. American Journal of Botany 96(5): 989-1010.

pmmd.notes: Strict MP consensus tree of 6912 most parsimonious trees of 2636 steps based on combined trnL-F and atpB-rbcL sequences of 131 samples (CI = 0.62, RI = 0.84, RC = 0.52). Bootstrap values and decay indices (bold and italics) are given above branches. Light gray boxes = Trichosporeae, dark gray boxes = Cyrtandreae; systematics (right side) follows Weber 2004; black bars = outgroups, hatched bars = gesnerioid, lined bars = coronantheroid, open bars = didymocarpoid, crosshatched = unassigned. Branches in bold are supported by posterior probabilities of 1.00 (black) or 0.99 (gray) in the Bayesian analysis. Asterisks indicate generic types. Arrow indicates a relationship found in the Bayesian analysis.
